department_name: San Bernardino County Department of Public Health, Division of Environmental Health Services

grading_system.description: Uses both numerical scores (0-100) and letter grades (A/B/C). Points are subtracted from 100 based on violations. Critical violations deduct 4 points, minor violations deduct 1-3 points.

inspection_details.frequency: Two yearly inspections for permitted facilities, with risk-based scheduling for high-risk facilities
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: C grade (70-79) requires mandatory follow-up inspection. Facilities scoring below 70 are temporarily closed. High-risk facilities include those with C grades, multiple B grades, or repeated 4-point violations.
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Letter grade cards must be posted in front window or approved location. Inspection reports available online since 2006 and on Yelp partnership.

fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Kitchen hood and duct extinguishing systems must be connected to fire alarm systems. Semi-annual inspections required per NFPA 96 standards.
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual inspections for kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (Cal Code) - part of California Health & Safety Code, modeled after FDA Food Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County conducts inspections. EHS is responsible for enforcing all food protection laws of the state within San Bernardino County per CA H&S Code §113713
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: San Bernardino County Code (SBCC) supplements state requirements. County has authority over wholesale food operations requiring state registration.
permit_types: Food Handler Card (required within 14 days of hire)

confidence_notes: Clear documentation of A/B/C grading system with specific score thresholds (A: 90-100, B: 80-89, C: 70-79). Detailed information on inspection frequency, risk categorization, and regulatory framework verified from multiple official sources.
verification_notes: All key information verified from official San Bernardino County sources including EHS website, inspection guides, county fire department, and local news coverage of inspection results.
